name.text: Identifying and Determining the Dimensions of a Cone

questiontext.text:
A cone has a perpendicular height of \({@h_cm@}\,\text{cm}\) and a slant height of \({@l_cm@}\,\text{cm}\). Take \(\pi = \frac{22}{7}\).

Determine the following:

  1. the radius of the cone

    \(\text{Radius}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. the volume of the cone to the nearest whole numbers

    \(\text{Volume}=\)[[input:ans2]]\(\,\text{cm}^3\)[[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
The cone has a perpendicular height of \({@h_cm@}\,\text{cm}\) and a slant height of \({@l_cm@}\,\text{cm}\).

Step 1: Determine the radius of the cone

For a cone, the radius \(r\), the perpendicular height \(h\), and the slant height \(l\) form a right-angled triangle.

\(\begin{align} l^2 &= r^2 + h^2 \end{align}\)

Substituting the given values:

\(\begin{align} ({@l_cm@})^2 &= r^2 + ({@h_cm@})^2 \\ r^2 &= ({@l_cm@})^2 - ({@h_cm@})^2 \\ r^2 &= {@l_cm@}^2 - {@h_cm@}^2 \\ r &= \sqrt{{@l_cm@}^2 - {@h_cm@}^2}\\ &={@r_cm@} \,\text{cm} \end{align}\)

Step 2: Find the volume of the cone

The formula for the volume of a cone is:

\(\begin{align} V &= \frac{1}{3} \times \text{base area} \times \text{height}\\ \text{Base area} &= \pi r^2 \\ &= \frac{22}{7} \times ({@r_cm@})^2\\ &={@base_area@}\,\text{cm}^2\\ \end{align}\)

Therefore,
\(\begin{align} V &= \frac{1}{3} \times {@base_area@}\times {@h_cm@} \\ &=\frac{1}{3} \times {@B_H@} \\ &={@ta@}\\ &={@ta_1@}\ \text{cm}^3 \end{align}\)

Rounded to the nearest whole number:
\(\begin{align} V &= {@ta_1@}\ \text{cm}^3 \end{align}\)

Therefore:

  1. The radius of the cone is \({@r_cm@}\,\text{cm}\).

  2. The volume of the cone is \({@ta_1@}\,\text{cm}^3\).

questionnote.text:
\(\text{The perpendicular height of the cone}={@h_cm@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The slant height of the cone}={@l_cm@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The radius of the cone}={@r_cm@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The volume of the cone}={@ta_1@}\,\text{cm}^3\)
